title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.59 - Executive Order No. 59: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Richmond. [DAGGER]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.59 - Executive Order No. 59: Placing requirement on Attorney General in relation to certain crimes committed by public servants in the County of Richmond. [DAGGER]
State Regulations

Executive Order No. 59.01*
Executive Order No. 59.02*
Executive Order No. 59.03
TO: THE HONORABLE LOUIS J. LEFKOWITZ ATTORNEY GENERAL OF
THE STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... Article I of my order and requirement to you, embodied in

Executive Order Number 59, dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred
seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (c) thereof to be
subdivision (d) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be subdivision (c), to read as follows: (c) without limiting the foregoing provisions, any and all
acts and omissions and alleged acts and omissions by any person occurring
heretofore or hereafter in the County of Richmond in violation of any provision
of State or local law and arising out of, relating to or in any way connected
with the receipt, possession, or disposal of dangerous drugs by the police
department of the City of New York, its officers, employees, or agents. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: December 28, 1972

Executive Order No. 59.21
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK 12224......................................................................................................................... WHEREAS, on the nineteenth day of September, one thousand
nine hundred seventy-two, a requirement was made by Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller, embodied in Executive Order Number 59, in relation to the County
of Richmond, which requirement has been continued and amended on subsequent
occasions; and
WHEREAS, on the thirty-first day of December, one thousand
nine hundred eighty-two, the office of the District Attorney of Richmond County
was vacated; and
WHEREAS, on the eleventh day of March, one thousand nine
hundred eighty-three, the term of the newly appointed District Attorney of

Richmond County commenced; NOW, THEREFORE, I do hereby reaffirm and continue, effective the first day of January, one thousand nine hundred eighty-three, the
order and requirement, embodied in Executive Order Number 59, and dated the
nineteenth day of September, one thousand nine hundred seventy-two, as
heretofore and hereafter amended. Signed: Mario M. Cuomo

Dated: July 25, 1983

Executive Order No. 59.22
TO: THE HONORABLE ROBERT ABRAMS ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK STATE CAPITOL ALBANY, NEW YORK......................................................................................................................... In view of the request of the District Attorney of Richmond

County, William L. Murphy, Article I of the order and requirement to you, embodied in Executive Order Number fifty-nine and dated September nineteenth, nineteen hundred seventy-two, is hereby amended by relettering subdivision (d)
thereof to be subdivision (e) and adding thereto one new subdivision, to be
subdivision (d), to read as follows: (d) Any and all criminal offenses committed or alleged to
have been committed by any person, relating to or in any way connected with the
assault on Salvator DePasquale, which incident occurred in the County of

Richmond on December 10, 1983. Signed: Mario M. Cuomo

Dated: December 28, 1983
